snippet: Rajiv Shah praised President Obama for giving the agency a stronger role in foreign policy decisions.
abstract: United States Agency for International Development administrator Rajiv Shah says that he will step down in early 2015; he is seen as having revived agency and working well with Congress.
lead_paragraph: Rajiv Shah praised President Obama for giving the agency a stronger role in foreign policy decisions.

headline.main: Chief of Agency for International Development to Step Down
headline.print_headline: Chief of Agency for International Development to Step Down
